title: The hardest skillshot to land?
body:
Lux's shield.
I swear, sometimes it feels like the team is actively trying to dodge it...

replies.body: Any skillshot aimed at Scuttle crab.
That motherfucker jukes everything

I'm not sad when I see a scuttle crab juke a skillshot.

I am sad when I see him juke better than I can.
Yeah, it's probably the only reason I don't think about playing Lux support anymore; it's like playing Ana in Overwatch and trying to hit your Genji doing parkour while he spams "Need Healing".

{{champion:267}} Haha, yeah!

I wonder if I was the only one who imagined this with your icon and comment XD

Agreed! As Lux I can (generally) predict where my opponent is going to path and where exactly to throw my Q so it hits them in the .75 seconds since I threw it, or guess their exact recall spot across half the map and snipe them with a laser, but when it comes to predicting where my 25 health ignited AD carry is going to path I fail miserably every time D:
Do they ever flash your W?
No, but if they did I would mock them endlessly on Discord :D

Ana main here 

I have never seen a more accurate statement

{{champion:99}} I'll protect you!
{{champion:56}} EW NO KEEP THAT THING AWAY FROM ME

{{champion:56}} Darkensssssss
{{champion:99}} Liiiiiight
.
.
.
{{champion:56}} Report Lux, trolling.

My teammates are good at dodging. 

Too bad they start in champ select.
give this man a medal for such a true comment.
ha

ww ult
that hit box is funky.  i can't count the number of times i've flown past a target that isn't moving.
\> When you ult right in front of the enemy but don't hit them but then you continue sliding at the end of the range and somehow end up past them.
I said the same thing shortly after released. Down voted. Seriously the hotbox really does feel off >.>
I see sh*t comin' --> I dodgin'

Agreed. I take this to extremes sometimes though lol. Yesterday I had an alumni on my team and in the middle of the teamfight he just came in from a flank, I forgot he was on my team, and wasted my ult on him. At first I was confused as to why the Ashe arrow went through him, then I got flamed because we lost the teamfight XD
whos alumni
That's one of the reasons I don't play blind pick. My teammates always jump scare me when there's a mirror match-up.

{{champion:110}}  R
{{champion:76}}  Q 
{{champion:30}}  Q
{{champion:427}} Q
{{champion:90}} Q
{{champion:4}} Q
{{champion:161}} Q
{{champion:101}} R E
{{champion:3}} E
Why do people say Varus ult is hard to hit? I rarely miss it the rare occasions I do play him.

> [{quoted}](name=MavenSong,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xtT9NGs8,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2017-04-10T11:59:24.719+0000)
>
> Why do people say Varus ult is hard to hit? I rarely miss it the rare occasions I do play him.

its cause its slow as fuck, most adc mains say its the hardest skill shot to land. that's why I put it on there
{{champion:157}} Q tornado is even fucking slower than that
But wider.

> [{quoted}](name=Hyrum Graff,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xtT9NGs8,comment-id=000b0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-10T13:34:58.812+0000)
>
> But wider.

wayyyyy wider
That's what she said.
http://reaction.club/r/a0b44ef017094683063c.gif

Hit Veigars W on a champion not in CC. Tell me if it's real.
Better yet, Heimerdongers Grenade for a stun. That's real hair trigger.

Pantheon's Q.
he
He
he
{{champion:13}} W and {{champion:30}} R are way harder.

Sion's everything against good players, especially against Riven, Fiora, Vayne, and Yasuo. Trying to land his full rotation on them is like trying to obtain the Holy Grail. They just dash around you, while spamming their mastery emote.
Can confirm as a longtime Sion main with a 70% winrate on the guy that fighting those four is COMPLETE HELL

Riven really isn't too hard, to be honest. Theoretically, yes, her high mobility kit is a hard counter to Sion, but, in practice, Riven mains are way too easy to bait and tilt with Sion.

Fiora is definitely a terrible match-up, but Yasuo isn't too bad unless you're trying to be aggressive. I'd honestly say Lucian is way worse than Vayne, too, although she can be rather frustrating.
lux has a shield? i thought she only had 3 skills
The join game button

or yet hooks that aren't leona's zenith blade seriously you throw a hook at the squishy adc that is for some reason frontline and instead hook the damn recalling malz that has his passive up in a bush that's a flash distance away
Really? I think everytime I've played Naut, Thresh or Blitz the hook feels legitimately rigged.

{{champion:14}} passive

your own team runs away from it harder then the enemy does


oh skillshots you say

{{champion:412}} lantern because it actually requires your teammate to have a brain and a finger

most of them have one of those but its surprisingly hard to find a teammate with both

thresh's lantern can be body blocked though. there was a game when i was getting ganked at bot, and the stupid fat pig {{champion:113}} stood on top of the lantern, making me auto her instead of taking the lantern.
Heimer E

Draven ult
Ashe ult
Jinx ult
Ezreal ult

Not even firing them across the map, I'm just bad at landing them.

Not gonna' lie. Lux throws something shiny at me, I autododge off reflex whether she's on my team or not. And there is no way I'm the only one, I've seen _plenty_ of other people dart out of the way too. You're not imagining things.

{{champion:53}} q
but when he's on the other team it's impossible to dodge
I'd have to say Shen's E. I'm good enough to thread an Ahri charm between two minions with only like a pixel in between but for some reason I can never get his taunt off.
Definitely {{champion:4}} 's Q; never guaranteed to hit something out of shotgun range unless you use some form of cc.
Fully Charged Xerath Qs for sure.
Technicallly not a skillshot
Technically yes it is, it just isn't a projectile. Anything not point and click is a skillshot
